New Records: Nick Martinez set a Reds franchise record with a strikeout-to-walk ratio of 6.44, surpassing previous records held by Johnny Cueto, Aaron Harang, Gary Nolan, and Joe Nuxhall.
Key Match Events: Nick Martinez pitched a complete game, throwing eight innings in a 1-0 loss to the Cubs.
Post-Match Reflections: Nick Martinez had a solid year, delivering what the team desired in a long guy, short inning reliever, and starter.
Despite the shutout, the Reds lost the game 1-0.
The offensive mediocrity has cost the team potential wins.
Nick Martinez's deal worked out better than the Montas and Pagan deals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nick Martinez finished the year with 142.1 innings pitched, a 3.10 ERA, 18 walks, and 116 strikeouts.
Martinez has a player option for the 2025 season, with the Reds paying him $12,000,000 if he exercises it.
Free agency could earn Martinez far more than $12,000,000.
There's a possibility Martinez could decline his option and the Reds would make him a qualifying offer.
Others: The Reds need a quality starting pitcher on the free agent market.
The team's offensive issues have been a significant factor in their struggles.
